analyzed: sa de'i spyod yul gnas ngan len shin tu cha phra ba yang dag par zad pa /
translated: The body of attributes, which is the body that is the object of the domain of that ground, is the utterly pure exhaustion of the most subtle of the negative tendencies of the lower grounds.

original: bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs yongs su rdzogs pa /
analyzed: bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs yongs su rdzogs pa /
translated: It is the complete perfection of the accumulations of merit and wisdom.

original: nyon mongs pa dang shes bya thams cad la gti mug gi mun pa chen po bstsal bas gnas gyur pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa brnyes pa'i phyir 'gro ba mtha' dag gi yul las shin tu 'das pa'i sku chos kyi sku gang yin pa de ni chos kyi
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang shes bya thams cad la gti mug gi mun pa chen po bstsal bas gnas gyur pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa brnyes pa'i phyir 'gro ba mtha' dag gi yul las shin tu 'das pa'i sku chos kyi sku gang yin pa de ni chos kyi
translated: It is the body of attributes that is the object of all transmigrating beings, because it is the attainment of the inconceivable transformation that has dispelled the great darkness of ignorance with regard to all afflictive obstructions and obstructions to omniscience.

original: sku zhes bya'o zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sku zhes bya'o zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: That is called the body of attributes.

original: de ltar sku gsum mtshan nyid las dpyad nas brda rtogs par bya ba'i phyir ;
analyzed: de ltar sku gsum mtshan nyid las dpyad nas brda rtogs par bya ba'i phyir ;
translated: Having analyzed the three bodies in that way, in order to understand the terms,

original: dang po gnyis ni btags pa'i yod //
analyzed: dang po gnyis ni btags pa'i yod //
translated: the first two are imputedly existent.

original: gsum pa don dam pa yang yin //üîΩzhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: gsum pa don dam pa yang yin // zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: The third is also ultimately existent.

original: yang na sku gsum bstan pa 'di ci thams cad don dam pa pa yin nam /
analyzed: yang na sku gsum bstan pa 'di ci thams cad don dam pa pa yin nam /
translated: Or, is this teaching of the three bodies all ultimate?

original: 'on te ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te ma yin zhe na /
translated: Or, is it not?

original: de'i phyir / sprul pa dang longs spyod rdzogs pa ni kun rdzob kyi spyod yul @10a * //üîΩlo zhes bstan to //
analyzed: de'i phyir / sprul pa dang longs spyod rdzogs pa ni kun rdzob kyi spyod yul @10a * // lo zhes bstan to //
translated: the emanation body and the beatific body are the domain of the conventional.

original: gsum pa chos kyi sku ni don dam pa pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: gsum pa chos kyi sku ni don dam pa pa zhes bya ste /
translated: The third body is called the absolute body.

original: don dam pas bsdus zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: don dam pas bsdus zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is the ultimate, that is, it is included in the ultimate.

original: ji ltar na de gnyis btags pa'i yod pa yin zhing gang la 'dogs she na /
analyzed: ji ltar na de gnyis btags pa'i yod pa yin zhing gang la 'dogs she na /
translated: How are the first two bodies nominally existent?

original: de dag las kyang gsum pa ni //
analyzed: de dag las kyang gsum pa ni //
translated: The third is their basis,

original: gnyis po gnas su gyur par 'dod //üîΩces bya ba smos te /
analyzed: gnyis po gnas su gyur par 'dod // ces bya ba smos te /
translated: and is accepted as their transformation.

original: chos kyi sku rten du gyur pa la brten nas de gnyis btags pa'i phyir de ni gnas zhes bya ste /
analyzed: chos kyi sku rten du gyur pa la brten nas de gnyis btags pa'i phyir de ni gnas zhes bya ste /
translated: The third body is called the basis because the first two bodies are nominally existent in dependence on it as their basis.

original: nags la sogs pa dag gi shing la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: nags la sogs pa dag gi shing la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: It is like trees in a forest, etc.

original: gsum pa de ni gnas yin pa'i phyir dang / de bzhin nyid yul yin pa'i phyir don dam pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: gsum pa de ni gnas yin pa'i phyir dang / de bzhin nyid yul yin pa'i phyir don dam pa zhes bya ste /
translated: The third body is called the ultimate because it is the basis and suchness is the object of the ultimate.

original: de gnyis ni gdul ba'i yul gyi dngos por nye bar 'gro ba'i phyir dang / res 'ga' mi gnas pa'i phyir btags pa'i yod pa yin la /
analyzed: de gnyis ni gdul ba'i yul gyi dngos por nye bar 'gro ba'i phyir dang / res 'ga' mi gnas pa'i phyir btags pa'i yod pa yin la /
translated: Since both of these are related to the substance of the object to be converted, and since they do not always exist, they are nominally existent.

original: cig shos ni 'jig rten thams cad kyi yul ma yin pa dang / 'khor ba ji srid par bzhugs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: cig shos ni 'jig rten thams cad kyi yul ma yin pa dang / 'khor ba ji srid par bzhugs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The other is not the object of all worlds, and it exists as long as transmigration exists.

original: chos gzhan dag kyang yod pa snyam na /
analyzed: chos gzhan dag kyang yod pa snyam na /
translated: If you think that there are other dharmas,

original: 'o na ci'i phyir chos kyi sku gcig pu don dam pas bsdus pa zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci'i phyir chos kyi sku gcig pu don dam pas bsdus pa zhes bya zhe na /
translated: then why is only the Dharma Body said to be included in the ultimate?üîΩTherefore he says,

original: de'i phyir / dri med de bzhin nyid dang ni //
analyzed: de'i phyir / dri med de bzhin nyid dang ni //
translated: Apart from stainless reality

original: mi rtog ye shes ma gtogs par //üîΩzhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: mi rtog ye shes ma gtogs par // zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: and nonconceptual intuition,

original: dri ma med ces bya ba ni glo bur gyi dri ma dang bral ba'i phyir ro //üîΩmi rtog ye shes zhes bya ba ni de bzhin nyid la dmigs pa ste /
analyzed: dri ma med ces bya ba ni glo bur gyi dri ma dang bral ba'i phyir ro // mi rtog ye shes zhes bya ba ni de bzhin nyid la dmigs pa ste /
translated: Stainless means free from adventitious defilements.üîΩNonconceptual intuition is that which has reality for its object.

original: dmigs par bya ba dang / dmigs par byed pa mtshungs snyam pa'i ye shes zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: dmigs par bya ba dang / dmigs par byed pa mtshungs snyam pa'i ye shes zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is called intuition because it is like a similitude of the object and subject of consciousness.

original: sangs rgyas rnams kyi chos gzhan ni //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams kyi chos gzhan ni //
translated: The other qualities of the BuddhasüîΩ

original: gang yang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gang yang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: There is no other dharma of the Buddhas.

original: zhes bya ba ni 'di gnyis la ma gtogs pa gzhan med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni 'di gnyis la ma gtogs pa gzhan med pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because there is nothing else apart from these two.

original: shes bya thams cad ni 'di gnyis kyi ngo bor gnas pa yin gyi gzhan gyi ngo bor ni ma yin te /
analyzed: shes bya thams cad ni 'di gnyis kyi ngo bor gnas pa yin gyi gzhan gyi ngo bor ni ma yin te /
translated: All objects of knowledge are included in these two natures, but not in any other natures.

original: ngo bo gzhan ni spros pa'i yul yin pas brdzun pa'i phyir dang / de bzhin gshegs pa rnams ni spros pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ngo bo gzhan ni spros pa'i yul yin pas brdzun pa'i phyir dang / de bzhin gshegs pa rnams ni spros pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Other natures are objects of conceptual elaborations and thus false, and the Tathagatas are free from conceptual elaborations.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams ye shes spangs pa phun sum tshogs pas phye bas ma yin nam /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams ye shes spangs pa phun sum tshogs pas phye bas ma yin nam /
translated: Aren‚Äôt the Tathagatas distinguished by their perfect knowledge and abandonment?

original: 'di gnyis ma gtogs par chos gzhan med ces bya zhe na /üîΩde'i phyir / de bzhin gshegs rnams ye shes dang // spangs pa phun sum tshogs pas phye //
analyzed: 'di gnyis ma gtogs par chos gzhan med ces bya zhe na / de'i phyir / de bzhin gshegs rnams ye shes dang // spangs pa phun sum tshogs pas phye //
translated: And how can you say that there is no other dharma apart from these two?

original: zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Therefore it is said: The Tathagatas are distinguished by their perfect knowledge and abandonment.

original: @10b sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ye shes phun sum tshogs pa dang spangs pa phun sum tshogs pas rab tu phye ba yin pa bden mod kyi /
analyzed: @10b sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ye shes phun sum tshogs pa dang spangs pa phun sum tshogs pas rab tu phye ba yin pa bden mod kyi /
translated: It is true that the Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, are distinguished by the perfection of knowledge and the perfection of abandonment.

original: de gnyis ni ji skad smos pa gnyis kyi nang du 'dus pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de gnyis ni ji skad smos pa gnyis kyi nang du 'dus pa'i phyir /
translated: But these two are included in the two mentioned above.

original: rtog med ye shes de bzhin nyid //
analyzed: rtog med ye shes de bzhin nyid //
translated: Nonconceptual knowledge and reality

original: dag pas de gnyis bsdus pa yin //üîΩzhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: dag pas de gnyis bsdus pa yin // zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: are included in those two perfections.

original: gal te 'di gnyis kyis bsdus par ma gyur na ni /üîΩbrgal zhing brtag pa 'di ltar yang 'gyur na /
analyzed: gal te 'di gnyis kyis bsdus par ma gyur na ni / brgal zhing brtag pa 'di ltar yang 'gyur na /
translated: If they were not included in those two, then this objection would apply:üîΩ‚ÄúIf nonconceptual knowledge is included in the perfection of knowledge,üîΩthen when it is free from conceptualization, knowledge is not perfect.üîΩIf it is not included in the perfection of knowledge, then knowledge is not nonconceptual.üîΩIf it is not included in the perfection of abandonment, then it is not pure.üîΩIf it is included in the perfection of abandonment, then when it is free from conceptualization, it is not knowledge.üîΩIf it is not included in those two, then what is it?üîΩAnd if it is included in those two, then why is it said that it is neither of those two?‚ÄùüîΩNonconceptual knowledge is included in the perfection of knowledge.

original: rtog pa med pa'i ye shes kyis ye shes phun sum tshogs pa bsdus pa ni yod do //üîΩgang gi tshe spros pa med par gyur na de lta na ye shes de phun sum tshogs pa yin te /
analyzed: rtog pa med pa'i ye shes kyis ye shes phun sum tshogs pa bsdus pa ni yod do // gang gi tshe spros pa med par gyur na de lta na ye shes de phun sum tshogs pa yin te /
translated: When it is free from conceptualization, then knowledge is perfect.

original: ji srid du rnam par rtog pa de srid du yongs su grub pa'i ye shes ma yin no //
analyzed: ji srid du rnam par rtog pa de srid du yongs su grub pa'i ye shes ma yin no //
translated: As long as there is conceptualization, it is not the knowledge of the perfected.

original: de bzhin nyid dag pas spangs pa phun sum tshogs te /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid dag pas spangs pa phun sum tshogs te /
translated: The perfection of abandonment is pure suchness.

original: ji srid du de bzhin nyid gcig pu gnas par 'gyur ba de srid du des rnam par rtog pa spang bar bya'o //
analyzed: ji srid du de bzhin nyid gcig pu gnas par 'gyur ba de srid du des rnam par rtog pa spang bar bya'o //
translated: As long as reality alone remains, conceptualization is to be abandoned.

original: de ltar de gnyis kyis gnyi ga bsdus pa yod do //üîΩrnam pa 'dis ye shes dang spangs pa phun sum tshogs pa bsdus pa yod pa bden mod kyi /
analyzed: de ltar de gnyis kyis gnyi ga bsdus pa yod do // rnam pa 'dis ye shes dang spangs pa phun sum tshogs pa bsdus pa yod pa bden mod kyi /
translated: Thus, both are included in the two.üîΩBy this method, the perfection of knowledge and abandonment are included in the two.

original: shes bya de kho nar zad dam ci na /
analyzed: shes bya de kho nar zad dam ci na /
translated: But is the knowable exhausted by just those two?üîΩOr are there other dharmas?

original: chos gzhan med ces bya ba rang gi don phun sum tshogs pa dang / gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa chos gzhan dag gis kyang bcom ldan 'das rnams sangs rgyas zhes brjod na /
analyzed: chos gzhan med ces bya ba rang gi don phun sum tshogs pa dang / gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa chos gzhan dag gis kyang bcom ldan 'das rnams sangs rgyas zhes brjod na /
translated: The Buddhas are called Blessed Ones because of the perfection of their own aim and the perfection of the aim of others by means of other dharmas.

original: brjod pa 'di rtog pa med pa'i ye shes dang de bzhin nyid dag la ji ltar rung zhe na /üîΩbde gshegs rnams ni rang gzhan don //
analyzed: brjod pa 'di rtog pa med pa'i ye shes dang de bzhin nyid dag la ji ltar rung zhe na / bde gshegs rnams ni rang gzhan don //
translated: But how can this expression be applied to the nonconceptual knowledge and reality?

original: phun tshogs pha rol gshegs par 'dod //
analyzed: phun tshogs pha rol gshegs par 'dod //
translated: The Sugatas are considered to have gone to the end of the aims of self and other.

original: ces bya ba smos so //
analyzed: ces bya ba smos so //
translated: He says this.

original: rang dang gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa'i rgya mtsho'i pha rol du bzhud pas /
analyzed: rang dang gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa'i rgya mtsho'i pha rol du bzhud pas /
translated: He has gone to the other shore of the ocean of the perfection of his own and others' aims.

original: rang gi don phun sum tshogs pa dang / gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa'i pha rol du gshegs pa zhes brjod do //
analyzed: rang gi don phun sum tshogs pa dang / gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa'i pha rol du gshegs pa zhes brjod do //
translated: Thus he is said to have gone to the other shore of the perfection of his own aim and the perfection of others' aims.

original: rang gi don phun sum tshogs pa ni rtog pa med pa'i ye shes te /
analyzed: rang gi don phun sum tshogs pa ni rtog pa med pa'i ye shes te /
translated: The perfection of his own aim is the nonconceptual intuition.

original: gal te rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes bla na med pa dang ldan na de lta na de rang gi don phun sum tshogs pa yin no //
analyzed: gal te rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes bla na med pa dang ldan na de lta na de rang gi don phun sum tshogs pa yin no //
translated: If he possesses the unsurpassed nonconceptual intuition, then he has the perfection of his own aim.

original: gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa ni de bzhin nyid dag pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa ni de bzhin nyid dag pa'i phyir te /
translated: The perfection of others' aims is due to the purification of reality.

original: shes bya'i tshogs thams cad de bzhin nyid du yongs su dag par byas pa'i phyir de lta na thams cad gzigs pa yin te /üîΩbsam pa dang bag la nyal la @11a * //
analyzed: shes bya'i tshogs thams cad de bzhin nyid du yongs su dag par byas pa'i phyir de lta na thams cad gzigs pa yin te / bsam pa dang bag la nyal la @11a * //
translated: Since he has purified the entire realm of the knowable in terms of reality, he is the all-seer.

original: sogs pa la gzigs pa'i rim gyis gzhan dag gi don sgrub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sogs pa la gzigs pa'i rim gyis gzhan dag gi don sgrub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: He accomplishes the aims of others by means of his vision of their thoughts, propensities, etc.

original: de'i phyir / de dag gi dngos de 'dra de'ang //
analyzed: de'i phyir / de dag gi dngos de 'dra de'ang //
translated: Therefore, it is said:üîΩThat reality of theirs is also

original: de nyid du ni bsdus pa yin //üîΩzhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de nyid du ni bsdus pa yin // zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: included in just that.

original: de dag gi zhes bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: de dag gi zhes bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi'o //
translated: ‚ÄúTheirs‚Äù refers to the Transcendent Lords.

original: dngos de 'dra zhes bya ba ni rang dang gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa'i pha rol du gshegs pa'i dngos po'o //
analyzed: dngos de 'dra zhes bya ba ni rang dang gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa'i pha rol du gshegs pa'i dngos po'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThat reality‚Äù refers to the fact that they have gone to the culmination of the perfection of benefit for self and other.

original: de'ang zhes bya ba ni bstan ma thag pa nyid do //
analyzed: de'ang zhes bya ba ni bstan ma thag pa nyid do //
translated: ‚ÄúAlso‚Äù refers to what has just been taught.

original: de nyid du zhes bya ba ni de bzhin nyid dang / rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes gnyis su'o //
analyzed: de nyid du zhes bya ba ni de bzhin nyid dang / rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes gnyis su'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIn just that‚Äù refers to the two, reality and non-conceptual intuition.

original: gal te de bzhin nyid dang / rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes ma gtogs par chos gzhan med na /
analyzed: gal te de bzhin nyid dang / rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes ma gtogs par chos gzhan med na /
translated: If there is no other reality apart from reality and non-conceptual intuition,

original: 'o na stobs dang mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa'i bye brag mtha' yas pa dang thun mong ma yin pa sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams dang / gzhan mngon par shes pa la sogs pa'i chos de dag kyang gsung rab las smos par ji ltar 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'o na stobs dang mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa'i bye brag mtha' yas pa dang thun mong ma yin pa sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams dang / gzhan mngon par shes pa la sogs pa'i chos de dag kyang gsung rab las smos par ji ltar 'gyur te /
translated: Well then, how can the infinite varieties of powers, fearlessnesses, and so on, the unshared qualities of the Buddha, and other qualities such as the superknowledges, be mentioned in the scriptures?

original: gnyis kho na smos pa'i rigs kyi /
analyzed: gnyis kho na smos pa'i rigs kyi /
translated: It would be reasonable to mention only two,

original: yi ge du ma'i gron tshegs dbyung ci dgos she na /üîΩde'i phyir / de yi dbang gis gzhan dag tu //
analyzed: yi ge du ma'i gron tshegs dbyung ci dgos she na / de'i phyir / de yi dbang gis gzhan dag tu //
translated: so why go to the trouble of using many letters?üîΩTherefore it says,

original: zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Because of that, in other scriptures,

original: de'i dbang gis zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ye shes kyi dbang gis te /
analyzed: de'i dbang gis zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ye shes kyi dbang gis te /
translated: Because of that means because of the power of supramundane wisdom.

original: de'i mthus zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de'i mthus zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: That means by its power.

original: bya ba sna tshogs snang bas na //
analyzed: bya ba sna tshogs snang bas na //
translated: Because of the appearance of various activities,

original: zhes bya ba ni 'gro ba'i bya ba du ma snang ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni 'gro ba'i bya ba du ma snang ba'i phyir te /
translated: means because of the appearance of the many activities of beings.

analyzed: gdul ba rnams kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba thabs sna tshogs kyis skye ba'i phyir ro //

analyzed: sangs rgyas chos rnams du ma dag / rnam par gzhag par 'dod pa yin //

translated: By this cause, the many qualities of the Buddha are established, are situated.

original: de lta bas na de gnyis kho na las rang dang gzhan la phan par bya ba'i tshogs mtha' dag 'grub ste /
analyzed: de lta bas na de gnyis kho na las rang dang gzhan la phan par bya ba'i tshogs mtha' dag 'grub ste /
translated: Therefore, the entire collection of benefits for oneself and others is accomplished by means of these two.

original: gdul bya'i bsam pa la ltos nas 'di nyid du chos 'di dag brjod pa yang nyes pa med do //
analyzed: gdul bya'i bsam pa la ltos nas 'di nyid du chos 'di dag brjod pa yang nyes pa med do //
translated: And there is no fault in teaching these subjects in this very text, in consideration of the inclinations of those to be trained.

original: rnam par mi rtog pa 'di gnyis la de'i bdag nyid ma yin pa'i chos rnam pa du ma rnam par gzhag par ji ltar rung zhe na /
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa 'di gnyis la de'i bdag nyid ma yin pa'i chos rnam pa du ma rnam par gzhag par ji ltar rung zhe na /
translated: How can it be proper to establish the many qualities of the nondiscriminating in a way that is not their nature?

original: rnam par rtog la kun nyon mongs //
analyzed: rnam par rtog la kun nyon mongs //
translated: The defiled is discrimination.

original: chos kun ji ltar gdags pa ltar //
analyzed: chos kun ji ltar gdags pa ltar //

original: zhes bya bas dpes ston te /
analyzed: zhes bya bas dpes ston te /

analyzed: rnam par rtog pa la kun nas nyon mongs pa'i chos @11b skyes pa dang / bud med dang gzung ba dang 'dzin pa la sogs pa dag par 'jog ste /
translated: He posits the dharmas of defilement in discursive thought, and the purity of women, the grasped, the grasper, etc.

analyzed: ji srid du rnam par rtog pa'i rgyun thog ma med pa'i dus nas zhugs pa 'di med par ma gyur pa de srid du 'khor ba'i rgyun rgyas par 'gyur te /
translated: As long as the stream of discursive thought, which has been flowing since beginningless time, does not cease, the stream of sa·πÉsƒÅra will continue to flow.

original: de ltar kun nas nyon mongs pa'i rgyur gyur pa chos 'di rnams 'dogs so //

original: de'i dbang du byas nas de skad brjod do //
analyzed: de'i dbang du byas nas de skad brjod do //
translated: With reference to that, it is said.

original: de ni 'di skad du nyi ma ni 'di snyam du chu dang bcas pa'i snod de lta bur ni bdag gi gzugs brnyan 'byung bar gyur cig / de lta bur 'byung bar ma gyur cig snyam du rnam par mi rtog mod kyi /
analyzed: de ni 'di skad du nyi ma ni 'di snyam du chu dang bcas pa'i snod de lta bur ni bdag gi gzugs brnyan 'byung bar gyur cig / de lta bur 'byung bar ma gyur cig snyam du rnam par mi rtog mod kyi /
translated: This is what is being said: The sun does not think, may my reflection appear in that way in a vessel filled with water, but may it not appear in that way.

original: de ltar rnam par mi rtog bzhin du rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba shin tu sna tshogs pas de ltar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar rnam par mi rtog bzhin du rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba shin tu sna tshogs pas de ltar 'gyur ro //
translated: Although it does not conceptualize in that way, it is due to the variety of dependent origination that it appears in that way.

original: de bzhin du ye shes phul du byung ba'i mthus 'di yang ci'i phyir mi 'byung zhes 'di yang de skad bstan par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de bzhin du ye shes phul du byung ba'i mthus 'di yang ci'i phyir mi 'byung zhes 'di yang de skad bstan par 'gyur te /
translated: In the same way, why would this not occur due to the power of the excellence of wisdom? This is also taught in that way.

original: bstan pa de'i phyir /üîΩde bzhin mi rtog bdag nyid kyi //
analyzed: bstan pa de'i phyir / de bzhin mi rtog bdag nyid kyi //
translated: For that reason,

original: sangs rgyas rnams kyi dbang gis na //üîΩskal ldan rnams la sku gnyis kyi //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams kyi dbang gis na // skal ldan rnams la sku gnyis kyi //
translated: the Buddhas, by their power,üîΩalways cause the reflection of the two bodies

original: gzugs brnyan rtag tu 'byung bar 'gyur //üîΩzhes bya ba smos te /üîΩ'dir rnam par rtog pa'am /
analyzed: gzugs brnyan rtag tu 'byung bar 'gyur // zhes bya ba smos te / 'dir rnam par rtog pa'am /
translated: to appear for the fortunate ones,üîΩeven though they are nonconceptual by nature.

original: rnam par mi rtog pas ci zhig bya ste /
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pas ci zhig bya ste /
translated: What is the use of conceptualization or nonconceptualization here?

original: ye shes kyi mthu 'di 'ang ba des skal ba ji lta ba bzhin du sprul pa dang longs spyod rdzogs pa zhes bya ba'i gzugs brnyan gnyis 'byung ste 'di ni mdor bstan pa'o //
analyzed: ye shes kyi mthu 'di 'ang ba des skal ba ji lta ba bzhin du sprul pa dang longs spyod rdzogs pa zhes bya ba'i gzugs brnyan gnyis 'byung ste 'di ni mdor bstan pa'o //
translated: This power of intuition always causes the reflection of the two bodies called emanation and beatific to appear for the fortunate ones in accordance with their worthiness. This is the brief teaching.

original: dper na bee d'urya'i gzhi la brgya byin gyi gzugs brnyan 'byung bar snang na /
analyzed: dper na bee d'urya'i gzhi la brgya byin gyi gzugs brnyan 'byung bar snang na /
translated: For example, when the reflection of Sakra appears on a crystal surface,

original: de mthong bas @13b gdul ba'i rang bzhin can gyi srog chags rnams /
analyzed: de mthong bas @13b gdul ba'i rang bzhin can gyi srog chags rnams /
translated: the creatures who are to be converted by that sight

original: bdag cag kyang 'di 'dra bar gyur kyang ci ma rung zhes dge ba'i rtsa ba dag bskyed do //
analyzed: bdag cag kyang 'di 'dra bar gyur kyang ci ma rung zhes dge ba'i rtsa ba dag bskyed do //
translated: generate the roots of virtue, thinking, ‚ÄúOh, if only we could become like that!‚Äù

original: de bzhin du dge ba'i rtsa ba ji lta ba bzhin du 'gro ba la bde bar gshegs pa rnams kyi gzugs brnyan 'di gnyis 'byung ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du dge ba'i rtsa ba ji lta ba bzhin du 'gro ba la bde bar gshegs pa rnams kyi gzugs brnyan 'di gnyis 'byung ste /
translated: Likewise, these two images of the Sugatas arise for beings in accordance with their roots of virtue.

original: de mthong nas sangs rgyas kyi mthus gdul ba'i sems can rnams sam /
analyzed: de mthong nas sangs rgyas kyi mthus gdul ba'i sems can rnams sam /
translated: Seeing them, through the power of the Buddha, those beings who are to be trained,

original: gzhan sems can gyi rnam pas gdul ba rnams dge ba'i rtsa ba khyad par du 'phags pa dag stsogs par byed do //
analyzed: gzhan sems can gyi rnam pas gdul ba rnams dge ba'i rtsa ba khyad par du 'phags pa dag stsogs par byed do //
translated: or those who are to be trained by other beings, accumulate the most excellent roots of virtue.

original: ji ste de ltar 'dod na chos kyi sku tha dad pa ma yin pa gzugs brnyan tha dad pa gnyis kyi rgyur ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: ji ste de ltar 'dod na chos kyi sku tha dad pa ma yin pa gzugs brnyan tha dad pa gnyis kyi rgyur ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: If you accept that, then how could the non-different Dharma Body be the cause of the two different images?

original: rgyu tha dad pa ma yin na rgyu las byung ba tha dad par yang ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: rgyu tha dad pa ma yin na rgyu las byung ba tha dad par yang ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If the cause is not different, how could what arises from the cause be different?

original: de bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: To explain that, it is said:

original: dper na chu snod bye brag gis //
analyzed: dper na chu snod bye brag gis //
translated: For example, due to the distinctions in the water vessels,

original: nam mkha' yi ni gzugs brnyan dag / tha dad par ni snang mod kyi //
analyzed: nam mkha' yi ni gzugs brnyan dag / tha dad par ni snang mod kyi //
translated: The images of space appear as different,

original: nam mkha' la ni tha dad med //üîΩces bya ba smos te //
analyzed: nam mkha' la ni tha dad med //üîΩces bya ba smos te //
translated: But there is no difference in space.

original: dper na nam mkha' ni tha dad pa'i ngo bo ma yin yang chu'i bye brag dang / snod kyi bye brag gis ring po dang thung ngu dang ser po la sogs pa'i bye brag tu tha dad pa'i ngo bo lta bur snang ngo //
analyzed: dper na nam mkha' ni tha dad pa'i ngo bo ma yin yang chu'i bye brag dang / snod kyi bye brag gis ring po dang thung ngu dang ser po la sogs pa'i bye brag tu tha dad pa'i ngo bo lta bur snang ngo //
translated: For example, space is not a different nature, but it appears as if it were a different nature, as having a different nature that is long or short, yellow, etc., due to the difference of the water and the difference of the vessel.

original: ji ste sa la chu dang snod kyi bye brag de med na ni ji ltar shin tu bsgrims te dmigs par 'dod kyang dmigs par mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: ji ste sa la chu dang snod kyi bye brag de med na ni ji ltar shin tu bsgrims te dmigs par 'dod kyang dmigs par mi 'gyur la /
translated: If there were no difference of water and vessel in the earth, then even if one were to try very hard to perceive it, one would not perceive it.

original: nam mkha' yang ji ltar yang tha dad par 'gyur ba med do //
analyzed: nam mkha' yang ji ltar yang tha dad par 'gyur ba med do //
translated: And space would not be different in any way.

original: de bzhin du chos kyi sku la yang rang gi ngo bos gzugs brnyan tha dad pa'i ngo bo nyid med pa 'di yang tha dad pa'i ngo bo nyid lta bu snang mod kyi /
analyzed: de bzhin du chos kyi sku la yang rang gi ngo bos gzugs brnyan tha dad pa'i ngo bo nyid med pa 'di yang tha dad pa'i ngo bo nyid lta bu snang mod kyi /
translated: In the same way, in the Dharma Body, which is not a different nature of images by way of its own nature, this is indeed an appearance as if it were a different nature.

original: 'on kyang de la ni tha dad pa shin tu cha phra ba ci yang med do //
analyzed: 'on kyang de la ni tha dad pa shin tu cha phra ba ci yang med do //
translated: But there is not the slightest difference in it.üîΩTherefore:

original: de'i phyir / de bzhin gzugs brnyan tha dad pa //
analyzed: de'i phyir / de bzhin gzugs brnyan tha dad pa //
translated: In the same way, the different images

original: gdul ba'i bsam pa'i bye brag gis //
analyzed: gdul ba'i bsam pa'i bye brag gis //
translated: are due to the difference in the intentions of those to be trained.

original: chos kyi sku las snang mod kyi //
analyzed: chos kyi sku las snang mod kyi //
translated: Although it appears from the Dharma Body,

original: de ni tha dad 'gyur ba med //
analyzed: de ni tha dad 'gyur ba med //
translated: it is not different from it.

original: ces bya ba smos so //
analyzed: ces bya ba smos so //
translated: This is what is said.

original: rnam par mi rtog bzhin du sems can mtha' dag ni don mdzad pa sgrub pa 'di yod do zhes nges par khas blang bar bya'o //üîΩde ltar ma yin na khams dang 'gro ba dang skye gnas kyi bye brag gis gdul ba'i ris kyi rnam pa mtha' yas pa dang / 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar dang / phra ba dang / rags pa dang / rtag pa dang /üîΩmi rtag pa dang / yod pa @14a * //
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog bzhin du sems can mtha' dag ni don mdzad pa sgrub pa 'di yod do zhes nges par khas blang bar bya'o // de ltar ma yin na khams dang 'gro ba dang skye gnas kyi bye brag gis gdul ba'i ris kyi rnam pa mtha' yas pa dang / 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar dang / phra ba dang / rags pa dang / rtag pa dang / mi rtag pa dang / yod pa @14a * //
translated: One should definitely accept that this accomplishment of the benefit of all sentient beings exists, even though it is nonconceptual.

original: dang ; med pa la sogs rnam par rtog pa sna tshogs kyis tha dad pa'i shes pa'i tshogs dang / shes bya thams cad la ye shes cig car 'jug par ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: dang ; med pa la sogs rnam par rtog pa sna tshogs kyis tha dad pa'i shes pa'i tshogs dang / shes bya thams cad la ye shes cig car 'jug par ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: If it were not so, then how could the gnosis of the Buddha, in one moment, penetrate all objects of knowledge, the infinite varieties of those to be trained, according to their differences of realm, destiny, and mode of birth, and according to their differences of the various kinds of conceptual thought, past, future, and present, subtle and gross, permanent and impermanent, existent and nonexistent, and so on?

original: shes bya cig car yongs su ma bcad na yang thams cad mkhyen pa zhes ji skad du bya ;
analyzed: shes bya cig car yongs su ma bcad na yang thams cad mkhyen pa zhes ji skad du bya ;
translated: If all objects of knowledge were not simultaneously discerned, how could one be called omniscient?

original: dus tha dad par gdul ba rnams kyi bsam pa la gzigs par yang ji ltar 'gyur te de bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dus tha dad par gdul ba rnams kyi bsam pa la gzigs par yang ji ltar 'gyur te de bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: To explain that, it is said:

original: gal te mi rtog de ltar min //
analyzed: gal te mi rtog de ltar min //
translated: If he does not think, it is not so.

original: sangs rgyas gzhan don mdzad mi 'gyur //üîΩzhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas gzhan don mdzad mi 'gyur // zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The buddhas would not perform for the sake of others.

original: de ni 'di skad du /
analyzed: de ni 'di skad du /
translated: This is what is being taught:

original: de ltar khas mi len na /
analyzed: de ltar khas mi len na /
translated: If one does not accept that,

original: bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa sa gsum gyi bla ma'i thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyang brtsal bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa sa gsum gyi bla ma'i thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyang brtsal bar 'gyur la /
translated: then the Bhagavat, the tathagata, the omniscience that is superior to the three realms would be sought,

original: gzhan gyi don kyang nyams par brjod par 'gyur /
analyzed: gzhan gyi don kyang nyams par brjod par 'gyur /
translated: and it would be said that the benefit of others would be impaired.

original: zhes bstan par 'gyur ro zhes de skad bstan par 'gyur te de'i phyir /
analyzed: zhes bstan par 'gyur ro zhes de skad bstan par 'gyur te de'i phyir /
translated: Thus it is taught. Therefore it is said:

original: de lta na ni kun mkhyen nyid //üîΩma grub pas ni gzhan don nyams //
analyzed: de lta na ni kun mkhyen nyid // ma grub pas ni gzhan don nyams //
translated: In that case, omniscience

original: zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: would not be established, and the benefit of others would be impaired.

original: de ltar dam bcas pa brtan por byas nas /
analyzed: de ltar dam bcas pa brtan por byas nas /
translated: Thus, having made that promise,

original: da ni de bsgrub pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni de bsgrub pa'i phyir /
translated: now, in order to accomplish that,üîΩit is said:üîΩThe teacher is to be analyzed

original: ston pa kun mkhyen nyid du ni //
analyzed: ston pa kun mkhyen nyid du ni //
translated: in terms of omniscience

original: cig car ram rim gyis brtag grang na //üîΩzhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: cig car ram rim gyis brtag grang na //üîΩzhes bya ba smos te /
translated: all at once or in stages.

original: bde bar gshegs pa'i thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gang brjod pa de shes bya yongs su gcod par byed pa'i mkhyen pa brnyes pas te /üîΩcig car du shes bya thams cad la khyab pa'i mkhyen pa mngon sum du gyur pa'i phyir ram /
analyzed: bde bar gshegs pa'i thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gang brjod pa de shes bya yongs su gcod par byed pa'i mkhyen pa brnyes pas te / cig car du shes bya thams cad la khyab pa'i mkhyen pa mngon sum du gyur pa'i phyir ram /
translated: The omniscience of the Sugata is described as the attainment of the knowledge that completely severs the object of knowledge.üîΩIs it because the knowledge that pervades all objects of knowledge simultaneously manifests, or is it because the knowledge that pervades all objects of knowledge gradually manifests?

original: 'on te rim gyis shes bya thams cad la khyab pa'i mkhyen pa mngon sum du gyur pa'i phyir thams cad mkhyen pa zhes bya grang zhes de skad bstan to //
analyzed: 'on te rim gyis shes bya thams cad la khyab pa'i mkhyen pa mngon sum du gyur pa'i phyir thams cad mkhyen pa zhes bya grang zhes de skad bstan to //
translated: Thus it is taught.

original: dngos po la mngon par zhen pa can khyod kyi de gnyi ga yang rigs pas mi rung ste de'i phyir /
analyzed: dngos po la mngon par zhen pa can khyod kyi de gnyi ga yang rigs pas mi rung ste de'i phyir /
translated: For you who cling to things, neither of those two is tenable, so it is said:

original: don smra rnams la rigs pas ni //
analyzed: don smra rnams la rigs pas ni //
translated: For the proponents of objects,

original: gnyi ga ltar yang de mi 'grub //üîΩces bya ba smos te /
analyzed: gnyi ga ltar yang de mi 'grub // ces bya ba smos te /
translated: neither is tenable through reasoning.

original: gang gis 'grub pa med pa'i rigs pa de gang zhe na /
analyzed: gang gis 'grub pa med pa'i rigs pa de gang zhe na /
translated: What is the reasoning by which they are not established?üîΩTherefore it is said:

original: de'i phyir / yod med yul la shes pa ni //
analyzed: de'i phyir / yod med yul la shes pa ni //
translated: Consciousness of existent or nonexistent objects

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te shes bya ni yod pa 'am med pa'i shes bya rnam pa gnyis su zad pas rnam par rtog pa gsum pa med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te shes bya ni yod pa 'am med pa'i shes bya rnam pa gnyis su zad pas rnam par rtog pa gsum pa med pa'i phyir /
translated: The two kinds of objects of knowledge are either existent or nonexistent.

original: shes bya thams cad ni 'di gnyis las mi 'da'o //
analyzed: shes bya thams cad ni 'di gnyis las mi 'da'o //
translated: Since there is no third kind of object of knowledge, all objects of knowledge are exhausted in these two.

original: yod pa la yang yod pa dang / med pa la yang med par shes @14b na shes bya thams cad yongs su gcod pa'i shes pa ni thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes zhes bya na /
analyzed: yod pa la yang yod pa dang / med pa la yang med par shes @14b na shes bya thams cad yongs su gcod pa'i shes pa ni thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes zhes bya na /
translated: The knowledge that completely understands all objects of knowledge is called the wisdom of omniscience.

original: phan tshun mi mthun pa'i phyir de gnyis ji ltar ngas gcig tu yongs su gcad par 'gyur te de'i phyir /
analyzed: phan tshun mi mthun pa'i phyir de gnyis ji ltar ngas gcig tu yongs su gcad par 'gyur te de'i phyir /
translated: Since these two are mutually exclusive, how could they be completely understood as one?

original: cig car 'jug par mi nus so //
analyzed: cig car 'jug par mi nus so //
translated: Therefore, they cannot be engaged simultaneously.

original: ji ltar gcig pu'i mtshan nyid de ;üîΩ/ sna tshogs don la dmigs par 'dod //
analyzed: ji ltar gcig pu'i mtshan nyid de ; / sna tshogs don la dmigs par 'dod //
translated: How can the characteristic of one

original: ces bya ba smos te /
analyzed: ces bya ba smos te /
translated: Be asserted to apprehend a variety of objects?

original: yod pa dang med pa'i yul la ye shes cig car 'jug par mi nus so //
analyzed: yod pa dang med pa'i yul la ye shes cig car 'jug par mi nus so //
translated: The wisdom that completely understands all objects of knowledge cannot simultaneously engage existent and nonexistent objects.

original: de'i sems kyi mtshan nyid ji snyed pa ni gcig yin la /
analyzed: de'i sems kyi mtshan nyid ji snyed pa ni gcig yin la /
translated: The characteristic of its mind is one.

original: shes bya thams cad la cig car khyab pa'i mkhyen pa brnyes pa'i phyir cig car du thams cad mkhyen par yang 'dod de /
analyzed: shes bya thams cad la cig car khyab pa'i mkhyen pa brnyes pa'i phyir cig car du thams cad mkhyen par yang 'dod de /
translated: Because he has attained the knowledge that simultaneously pervades all objects of knowledge, he is also asserted to be omniscient in all things simultaneously.

original: de'i phyir 'di ltar shes pa'i skad cig gcig ni don sna tshogs la dmigs par mi rung ngo //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di ltar shes pa'i skad cig gcig ni don sna tshogs la dmigs par mi rung ngo //
translated: Therefore, it is not suitable for a single moment of knowledge to focus on various objects.

original: ji ste de ltar 'dod na ci'i phyir sems gcig don sna tshogs la dmigs par mi 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ji ste de ltar 'dod na ci'i phyir sems gcig don sna tshogs la dmigs par mi 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If you assert that, why wouldn‚Äôt a single mind focus on various objects?

original: smras pa / mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa ni re zhig rang gi yul nges pa'i phyir yul yongs su bcad pa ste /
analyzed: smras pa / mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa ni re zhig rang gi yul nges pa'i phyir yul yongs su bcad pa ste /
translated: We say that the consciousnesses of the eye and so on are determinate objects because they are ascertained in relation to their own objects.

original: de'i phyir des don sna tshogs ji ltar 'dzin /
analyzed: de'i phyir des don sna tshogs ji ltar 'dzin /
translated: Therefore how could they apprehend various objects?

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i yul yang 'gags ma thag pa'i yul la cig car mi 'jug gi / spyi'i rnam par de 'jug ste //
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i yul yang 'gags ma thag pa'i yul la cig car mi 'jug gi / spyi'i rnam par de 'jug ste //
translated: Also, the object of mental consciousness does not simultaneously engage the object that has just ceased; it engages the object in a general way.

original: spyi'i rnam par yongs su gcod pa'i shes pa ni thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes zhes khas blang bar mi nus te /
analyzed: spyi'i rnam par yongs su gcod pa'i shes pa ni thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes zhes khas blang bar mi nus te /
translated: It is not possible to assert that the consciousness that determines the aspect of a generality is omniscient.

original: thams cad kyang de yin par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thams cad kyang de yin par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would follow that all would be that way.

original: zag pa med pa'i shes pa bden pa bzhis bsdus pa'i chos shes pa la sogs pa yod pa de yang 'dod pa dang / gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams kyi yul la dmigs pa nyid yin pas /
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i shes pa bden pa bzhis bsdus pa'i chos shes pa la sogs pa yod pa de yang 'dod pa dang / gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams kyi yul la dmigs pa nyid yin pas /
translated: That uncontaminated knowledge that is included in the four truths, such as Dharma knowledge and so on, also focuses on the objects of the desire, form and formless realms.

original: yul so sor nges pa nyid yin par khas blang dgos so //
analyzed: yul so sor nges pa nyid yin par khas blang dgos so //
translated: Therefore it must be accepted that it is ascertained with respect to its object.

original: kun rdzob shes pa ni res 'ga' 'byung ba ste /
analyzed: kun rdzob shes pa ni res 'ga' 'byung ba ste /
translated: Conventional knowledge sometimes arises.

original: de yang zag pa med pa'i rjes la thob pa yin pa'i phyir yul thams cad la dmigs par mi 'dod do //
analyzed: de yang zag pa med pa'i rjes la thob pa yin pa'i phyir yul thams cad la dmigs par mi 'dod do //
translated: Moreover, it is not asserted that it focuses on all objects because it is obtained subsequent to uncontaminated knowledge.

original: su gang dag thams cad mkhyen pa yin par 'dod pa de'i yang rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: su gang dag thams cad mkhyen pa yin par 'dod pa de'i yang rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: It is also illogical for those who assert that the omniscient one is a person.

original: gang zag tu smra ba de dag ni 'di skad du shes pa la brten nas gang zag gis shes so zhes bya'o zhes 'dzer te /üîΩshes pa de yang @15a * //
analyzed: gang zag tu smra ba de dag ni 'di skad du shes pa la brten nas gang zag gis shes so zhes bya'o zhes 'dzer te / shes pa de yang @15a * //
translated: Because those who propound the person say, ‚ÄúThe person knows by relying on consciousness.‚Äù

original: dpyad na ji skad smos pa'i shes pa'i nang du 'dus pa nyid do //
analyzed: dpyad na ji skad smos pa'i shes pa'i nang du 'dus pa nyid do //
translated: And when that consciousness is analyzed, it is included in the consciousnesses mentioned above.

original: de ltar na re zhig cig car gyis thams cad mkhyen pa nyid med do //
analyzed: de ltar na re zhig cig car gyis thams cad mkhyen pa nyid med do //
translated: Thus, omniscience does not exist in a single moment.

original: de lta yin du zin kyang rim gyis yul yongs su gcod de /
analyzed: de lta yin du zin kyang rim gyis yul yongs su gcod de /
translated: Even if that were so, the object is discerned sequentially.

original: shes pa de 'jug pa na shes bya ma lus pa yongs su spyod pa'i phyir thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du 'grub bo zhe na /
analyzed: shes pa de 'jug pa na shes bya ma lus pa yongs su spyod pa'i phyir thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du 'grub bo zhe na /
translated: Since that consciousness engages in the complete knowledge of all objects of knowledge, it is established as omniscience.

original: de'i phyir / de lta min na dus gcig na //
analyzed: de'i phyir / de lta min na dus gcig na //
translated: To respond: If that were not so,

original: gdul ba mang po rnams kyi don //üîΩnyams par 'gyur la ston pa yi //

analyzed: ji ste rgyun gyis nus pa'i phyir dper na mes thams cad sreg pa bzhin te /

analyzed: cig car thams cad rigs pa ma yin pa'i phyir thams cad mkhyen pa yang de ltar blta bar bya'o zhe na /

original: de lta na ni dngos su med pa'i phyir sangs rgyas rnams kyi thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ni btags pa yin par khas blangs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta na ni dngos su med pa'i phyir sangs rgyas rnams kyi thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ni btags pa yin par khas blangs par 'gyur ro //

original: gal te shes bya rnam pa du ma yod pa thams cad dus gcig tu yongs su gcod na ni de lta na thams cad thugs su chud pa zhes bya bas thams cad mkhyen pa'i sgra dngos su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te shes bya rnam pa du ma yod pa thams cad dus gcig tu yongs su gcod na ni de lta na thams cad thugs su chud pa zhes bya bas thams cad mkhyen pa'i sgra dngos su 'gyur ro //
translated: If it is the case that the many aspects of objects of knowledge exist and are completely known simultaneously, then it would be called the complete understanding of everything, and the term omniscience would be literal.

original: de yi phyir na ston pa yi //
analyzed: de yi phyir na ston pa yi //

original: kun mkhyen nyid ni btags yin 'gyur //
analyzed: kun mkhyen nyid ni btags yin 'gyur //

original: zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: This is what is said.

original: 'o na thams cad mkhyen pa ji lta bu yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na thams cad mkhyen pa ji lta bu yin zhe na /

original: de bsgrub pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de bsgrub pa'i phyir /

analyzed: dus gsum shes bya tha dad kun //

original: gang phyir gnyis med mtshan nyid du //
analyzed: gang phyir gnyis med mtshan nyid du //

analyzed: de mkhyen bcom ldan 'das de'i phyir //

analyzed: cig car thams cad mkhyen par 'dod //

original: ces bya bas rang gi lta ba ston par byed de /
analyzed: ces bya bas rang gi lta ba ston par byed de /

original: gang gi phyir dus gsum la sogs pa shes bya tha dad pa thams cad gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam par mi dmigs pa'i tshul du cig car mkhyen te /

analyzed: de'i phyir bcom ldan 'das ni sngar mdzad zin par brjod do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //

translated: Thus, because he has attained the knowledge that pervades all objects of knowledge by the way of non-elaboration, the Transcendent Lords, the Buddhas, are said to possess non-conceptual knowledge without conceptualization.

analyzed: gal te sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams rnam par mi rtog pa yin na ci'i phyir mdo gzhan las /

analyzed: de bstan pa'i phyir / log pa gnyis su lta ba yi //

analyzed: byis pa rnams ni rtog med 'dod // gnyis med yang dag yod gzigs pa //

original: zhes bya ba smos te /

translated: The reply to the objection that the various activities of the buddhas, which are performed by means of supramundane gnosis, are not possible for those who are nonconceptual is given by the examples of the sun and so on.üîΩThis other point should be stated: When the various activities of the imagination of what is unreal, which is false, appear, why would the various activities of the imagination of what is real not appear?

analyzed: la gnas pa'i don mdzad pa de lta smos kyang ci dgos te //

original: ci'i phyir mi 'byung /
analyzed: ci'i phyir mi 'byung /

original: yang dag pa mi yin pa la kun rtog pa la ni thog ma med pa'i dus nas kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la sa bon rnam pa sna tshogs gnas pa'i nas pa yongs su smin pa'i dbang gis tha snyad gdags pa'i bya ba sna tshogs 'grub tuüîΩrung na / rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes 'di ni sa bon med pa kho na yin na 'di las ji @16a * //

translated: In the case of the imagination of what is unreal, the various conventional activities are accomplished through the power of the full maturation of the seeds of various kinds that are present in the store consciousness from beginningless time.

analyzed: rnam par rtog pa 'jug pa yi //

analyzed: rten ni rtsa ba'i sems yin te //

analyzed: de yi dbang gis de bzhin nyid //

analyzed: de la sa bon gnas pa'i phyir de ni rtsa ba'i yan lag yin pa ji lta ba de bzhin du /

translated: This is what is being said: because of the destruction of the omnipresent conceptualization that is engaged in many aspects, knowledge also obtains the perfection of mastery in just those aspects, as it is known.

analyzed: gang gi phyir 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam pa la sogs pa rnam pa thams cad kyi bdag nyid phan tshun du bsam pa rig pa'i mtshan nyid tha snyad gdags pa thams cad 'jug pa'i 'byung ba'i rgyur gyur pa de'i phyir de

analyzed: de'i phyir / gang phyir longs spyod rdzogs pa la // phan dang bde mdzad mthar phyin pa //

original: 'di yang de bzhin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'di yang de bzhin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This is the meaning of ‚Äújust like that.

analyzed: chos kyi sku ni rang bzhin nyid kyis ngo bo nyid kho nas rtag pa ste ; de'i phyir / 'dus ma byas pa yin pa'i phyir //

analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te /

analyzed: 'dis ther zug tu gnas pa'i rtag pa nyid bstan to //

original: gzhan du 'gyur pa med pa'i phyir //

analyzed: de'i phyir / nam mkha' bzhin du 'dod pa yin // zhes bya ba smos so //

analyzed: gnas skabs gang na sku gang yod par bstan pa'i phyir ; sprul yod longs spyod rdzogs pa med //

analyzed: longs spyod rdzogs yod cig shos med //

analyzed: de kho na mthong ba med pa'i phyir de na longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku mthong ba med do //

original: mtshan ma med pa brgyad pa la sogs pa rnams la ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams longs spyod rdzogs sku mthong ba la na yin gyi sprul pa'i sku mthong ba med de de ni dge ba'i rtsa ba yongs su ma smin pa rnams yongs su smin par bya
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa brgyad pa la sogs pa rnams la ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams longs spyod rdzogs sku mthong ba la na yin gyi sprul pa'i sku mthong ba med de de ni dge ba'i rtsa ba yongs su ma smin pa rnams yongs su smin par bya

analyzed: mtshan ma dang bcas pa rab tu dga' ba la sogs pa rnams na ni longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku dang sprul pa zhes bya ba yang snang ngo //

original: sangs rgyas kyi sa la ni chos kyi sku gcig bur zad kyi gnyis po med @22b de ;
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi sa la ni chos kyi sku gcig bur zad kyi gnyis po med @22b de ;

analyzed: spros pa'i dngos po'i yul yin pa'i phyir dang / chos kyi sku ni spros pa med pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: de'i phyir go rims bzhin zhes bya ba smos so //

analyzed: grub la de yod ga la 'gyur //

analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te /

analyzed: phan tshun gyi dbang gis 'bras bu ci yang mi dmigs so zhes bya bar bsams pa'o //

original: da ni de'i lan du /
analyzed: da ni de'i lan du /

translated: In order to demonstrate this, and in order to demonstrate the perfection of the Enjoyment Body of the Sage,üîΩwhich is revealed by the perfection of one's own aim,üîΩand in order to demonstrate the perfection of the Transformation Body,üîΩwhich is revealed by the perfection of others' aims, it is said:üîΩThe Enjoyment Body of the Sage,

analyzed: ces bya ba smos te /

analyzed: de'i phyir sangs rgyas kyis nyid la ni ldog pa dang gyur pa ste /

analyzed: de'i phyir / rnam par mi rtog ye shes kyis //
translated: By nonconceptual intuition

analyzed: de lta bas na sku gsum po dag ni de'i 'bras bu nyid du brjod pas de'i phyir / de'i 'bras bu sku 'thob po //

analyzed: zhes bya ba smos so //

analyzed: ci'i phyir de rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyi 'bras bur brjod kyi /

analyzed: 'di ni 'di skad du shes pa gzhan ni sgro btags pa'i dngos po la gnas pa'i phyir dang / shes bya gzhan ni log pa'i rnam par zhugs pa'i phyir de gnyis la ma gtogs pa'i bden pa gzhan med do zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //

analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te /

analyzed: zhes bya ba de la gzhan gyi dbang ni rnam par rtog pa'i ngo bo nyid yin te /

analyzed: zhes bya ba smos so //

analyzed: gsal dang mi gsal gang yin pa //

analyzed: gnyis po med pa'i don rtogs pa //

analyzed: de ni gsal zhes brjod pa yin // gnyis kyi don ni rtogs gyur pa //

analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te /

original: de ltar na sku gsum bstan pa de dag ni chos kyi sku dang longs spyod rdzogs pa dang sprul pa dang / bshad pa'i sku'i bye brag gis phung po bzhi'o //
analyzed: de ltar na sku gsum bstan pa de dag ni chos kyi sku dang longs spyod rdzogs pa dang sprul pa dang / bshad pa'i sku'i bye brag gis phung po bzhi'o //
translated: Thus, the teaching of the three bodies is a classification of the four bodies, the body of the dharma, the beatific body, the emanation body, and the body of enjoyment.

original: de dag gi tshad kyi rab tu dbye ba ni /
analyzed: de dag gi tshad kyi rab tu dbye ba ni /

original: zhes smos pa yin te /

analyzed: tshad kyi rab tu dbye ba 'dis ni tshad gsum smos pa'i phyir /

original: sangs rgyas kyi sku ni rnam pa gsum du 'dod pa de ston par byed do //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi sku ni rnam pa gsum du 'dod pa de ston par byed do //

original: rnam pa dgus ni chos kyi sku de ston to //
analyzed: rnam pa dgus ni chos kyi sku de ston to //

original: der zhes bya ba ni mdo der ro //
analyzed: der zhes bya ba ni mdo der ro //

original: dgu po dag ni nam mkha'i sku dang / 'jig rten gsum po thams cad las bye brag tu 'phags pa'i sku dang / mi mnyam pa mnyam pa'i sku dang / sems can thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid dang ldan pa'i sku dang / dpe med pa dang /
analyzed: dgu po dag ni nam mkha'i sku dang / 'jig rten gsum po thams cad las bye brag tu 'phags pa'i sku dang / mi mnyam pa mnyam pa'i sku dang / sems can thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid dang ldan pa'i sku dang / dpe med pa dang /
translated: The nine are the space-like body, the body that is superior to all three worlds, the body that is equal to the unequalled, the body that possesses the suchness of all sentient beings, the body that is without example, the body that is the same as the body of all buddhas, the body that is the same as the body of all sentient beings, the body that is the same as the body of all phenomena, and the body that is the same as the body of all world systems.

original: 'dra ba med pa dang / rang bzhin gyis kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa'i sku dang / rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba'i sku dang / rang bzhin gyis ma skyes pa'i sku ste /
analyzed: 'dra ba med pa dang / rang bzhin gyis kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa'i sku dang / rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba'i sku dang / rang bzhin gyis ma skyes pa'i sku ste /
translated: The nine are: the space-like body, the body that is superior to all three worlds, the body that is equal to the unequalled, the body that possesses the thusness of all sentient beings, the body that is without example, the body that is without compare, the body that is naturally free from defilement, the body that is naturally radiant, and the body that is naturally unborn.

original: mdo'i tshig dgu po 'di dag gis ni chos kyi sku yongs su bstan to //
analyzed: mdo'i tshig dgu po 'di dag gis ni chos kyi sku yongs su bstan to //

original: tshig lnga lngas ni rgyu mthun pa dang sprul pa'i sku re re ston te /
analyzed: tshig lnga lngas ni rgyu mthun pa dang sprul pa'i sku re re ston te /

original: de dag gis sprul pa dang / longs spyod rdzogs pa ston to //
analyzed: de dag gis sprul pa dang / longs spyod rdzogs pa ston to //
translated: They reveal the Transformation Body and the Body of Apparition.

original: de gnyi ga gcig tu bsdus nas 'chad pa'i sku zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de gnyi ga gcig tu bsdus nas 'chad pa'i sku zhes bya ste /
translated: These two are combined into one and called the ‚ÄúExpounding Body.‚Äù

original: de'i phyir / 'chad pa'i sku ni rnam gcig go //üîΩzhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir / 'chad pa'i sku ni rnam gcig go //üîΩzhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Therefore, it says, ‚ÄúThe Expounding Body is one.‚Äù

original: de ltar rab tu dbye ba'i mtshan nyid bstan nas mtshan nyid gzhan bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar rab tu dbye ba'i mtshan nyid bstan nas mtshan nyid gzhan bstan par bya ba'i phyir /

original: mtshan nyid lhag ma zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: mtshan nyid lhag ma zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Having thus taught the characteristics of the divisions, in order to teach other characteristics, he says,

analyzed: tshad la sogs pa ni tshig gcig dang / gnyis dang / gsum dang / dgu dang / drug dang / lngas ston te /

original: go rims bzhin du khong du chud par bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: go rims bzhin du khong du chud par bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //

original: tshad ji ltar na gcig gis ston zhe na /
analyzed: tshad ji ltar na gcig gis ston zhe na /
translated: How is the measure taught by one word?

original: phyogs bcu ma lus pa nam mkha'i khams khyab pa'i sku de bstan par khong du chud par bya ste /
analyzed: phyogs bcu ma lus pa nam mkha'i khams khyab pa'i sku de bstan par khong du chud par bya ste /

original: sku bstan pa'i sku thams cad der 'dus pa'i phyir ro /
analyzed: sku bstan pa'i sku thams cad der 'dus pa'i phyir ro /
translated: because all bodies taught are included in that.üîΩThe body equal to all sentient beings and the body without end or middle are taught by two words.

original: sems can thams cad mnyam pa'i sku dang / mtha' yas mu med pa'i ste de gnyis kyis ni mtha' @35b bstan par khong du chud par bya ste /
analyzed: sems can thams cad mnyam pa'i sku dang / mtha' yas mu med pa'i ste de gnyis kyis ni mtha' @35b bstan par khong du chud par bya ste /

analyzed: sems can gyi khams ji tsam par bzhugs pas sku mtha' yas mu med pa'i phyir ro //

original: tshig gsum gyis ni phrin las bstan par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: tshig gsum gyis ni phrin las bstan par rig par bya ste /
translated: One should understand that the three phrases indicate activity.

original: 'gyur ba med cing rtag pa med pa'i sku dang / mi g-yo zhing rlom sems med pa'i sku dang / gnas pa las mi g-yo bar gyur pa'i sku ste /
analyzed: 'gyur ba med cing rtag pa med pa'i sku dang / mi g-yo zhing rlom sems med pa'i sku dang / gnas pa las mi g-yo bar gyur pa'i sku ste /
translated: The body that is without change and without permanence, the body that is without movement and without conceit, and the body that does not move from the state‚Äî

original: tshig de dag gis ston to //
analyzed: tshig de dag gis ston to //

original: ngo bo nyid ni gzugs kyi rang bzhin ma yin pa'i sku dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa'i rang bzhin ma yin pa'i sku dang / sa'i khams kyis rab tu phye ba ma yin pa dang /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid ni gzugs kyi rang bzhin ma yin pa'i sku dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa'i rang bzhin ma yin pa'i sku dang / sa'i khams kyis rab tu phye ba ma yin pa dang /
translated: The essence is the body that is not the nature of form, the body that is not the nature of feeling, perception, formation, or consciousness, and the body that is not distinguished by the earth element,

analyzed: chu'i khams kyis phye ba ma yin pa dang ; me'i khams kyis phye ba ma yin pa dang / rlung gi khams kyis rab tu phye ba ma yin pa ste /

original: sku dgu po 'di dag gis bstan par khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: sku dgu po 'di dag gis bstan par khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: One should understand that these nine bodies are taught.

original: 'byung ba ni tshig drug gis bstan te /
analyzed: 'byung ba ni tshig drug gis bstan te /

original: kun nas ma byung ba dang 'byung ba chen po ma yin pa dang / 'byung ba chen pos rab tu phye ba ma yin pa dang / 'byung ba ma yin pa dang 'byung ba ma yin pa'i chos dang / 'jig rten thams cad dang mi mthun pa'o zhes bya ba la thug pa dag gis ston to //
analyzed: kun nas ma byung ba dang 'byung ba chen po ma yin pa dang / 'byung ba chen pos rab tu phye ba ma yin pa dang / 'byung ba ma yin pa dang 'byung ba ma yin pa'i chos dang / 'jig rten thams cad dang mi mthun pa'o zhes bya ba la thug pa dag gis ston to //
translated: It is not a product, not a great element, not distinguished by the great elements, not an element, not a phenomenon that is not an element, and it is not in accord with the entire world.

original: phan 'dogs pa 'dzin pa ni /
analyzed: phan 'dogs pa 'dzin pa ni /

original: mig las ma byung ba dang / rna ba la mi gnas pa dang / snas rnam par shes par bya ba ma yin pa dang / lces rab tu phye ba ma yin pa dang / lus dang ldan pa ma yin pa dang / yid kyis nye bar dpyad pa ma yin pa zhes bya ba drug po 'di dag gis ston to //
analyzed: mig las ma byung ba dang / rna ba la mi gnas pa dang / snas rnam par shes par bya ba ma yin pa dang / lces rab tu phye ba ma yin pa dang / lus dang ldan pa ma yin pa dang / yid kyis nye bar dpyad pa ma yin pa zhes bya ba drug po 'di dag gis ston to //
translated: It does not arise from the eye, it does not abide in the ear, it is not cognized by the nose, it is not distinguished by the tongue, it is not associated with the body, and it is not analyzed by the mind.

original: 'jug pa ni lngas bstan par shes par bya ste /
analyzed: 'jug pa ni lngas bstan par shes par bya ste /
translated: The engagement should be understood to be taught by five:

original: de ltar tshig tsam zhig bstan pas mdor bsdu ste /
analyzed: de ltar tshig tsam zhig bstan pas mdor bsdu ste /
translated: Thus, by teaching just the words, in brief,

analyzed: mtshan nyid rnam pa brgyad kyi skabs kyis de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku bstan pa bsdus par rig par bya'o //
translated: the body of the TathƒÅgata should be understood to be included in the context of the eight characteristics.

original: tshig gi don ni go rims bzhin //
analyzed: tshig gi don ni go rims bzhin //
translated: The meaning of the words is in order.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni ji skad smos pa'i tshig rnams kyi don ston to //üîΩgo rims bzhin zhes bya ba ni nam mkha'i sku zhes bya ba nas bzung ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni ji skad smos pa'i tshig rnams kyi don ston to // go rims bzhin zhes bya ba ni nam mkha'i sku zhes bya ba nas bzung ste /
translated: Here, the meaning of the words as stated is taught.

original: phyis ldog pa med pa zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
analyzed: phyis ldog pa med pa zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
translated: In order means from the body of space up to not turned back later.üîΩHere, the cause of non-obstruction, etc., up to

analyzed: 'di la sgrib pa med pa'i rgyu yin pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa nas / de bzhin mya ngan @36a * //
translated: the cause of non-differentiation.

original: 'das srid la //
analyzed: 'das srid la //
translated: In the same way, nirvana and existence,

original: gnas pa med pa'i dngos po'i phyir //
analyzed: gnas pa med pa'i dngos po'i phyir //
translated: because of the non-abiding of things,üîΩare not different.

analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la thug pa'i bar du go rims bzhin don bstan zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning of the rest of the passage up to ‚Äúthe body of space‚Äù should be understood in the same way.

analyzed: de la nam mkha'i sku zhes ci'i phyir bya zhe na / de'i phyir / sgrib pa med pa'i rgyu yin pas //
translated: Why is it called the body of space?üîΩTherefore it is said:

analyzed: shes bya thams cad la ye shes thogs pa med pa'o //

original: dper na nam mkha' la gzugs can thams cad thogs pa med par 'gro ba dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: dper na nam mkha' la gzugs can thams cad thogs pa med par 'gro ba dang 'dra ste /
translated: For example, just as in space all forms move without obstruction,

analyzed: de'i phyir / de'i sku nam mkha' dang 'dra bas nam mkha'i sku zhes bya'o //
translated: so the body of the Buddha is like space, and therefore it is called the body of space.

original: bla na med phyir zhes bya ba ni de las khyad par du 'phags pa'i lus gzhan med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: bla na med phyir zhes bya ba ni de las khyad par du 'phags pa'i lus gzhan med pa'i phyir te /

original: de'i phyir / 'jig rten gsum po thams cad las bye brag tu 'phags pa'i sku zhes bya'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir / 'jig rten gsum po thams cad las bye brag tu 'phags pa'i sku zhes bya'o zhes gsungs so //

original: lus can kun dang mi mtshungs phyir //
analyzed: lus can kun dang mi mtshungs phyir //

translated: The meaning of ‚Äúwithout example‚Äù is that it is not an example.

analyzed: 'dra ba med pa ni /
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúwithout similarity‚Äù is

analyzed: gnyis dngos med phyir zhes bya ba ste /

analyzed: rang bzhin gyis kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa'i sku dang / rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba'i sku zhes bya ba de gnyis kyi don bstan pa'i phyir / gyur pa'i phyir dang log pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the meaning of the two, the ‚Äúbody of the absence of intrinsic reality of affliction‚Äù and the ‚Äúbody of the intrinsic clarity,‚Äù

analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: it says, ‚Äúbecause of transformation and because of reversal.‚Äù

analyzed: de'i phyir / rang 'od gsal phyir zhes bya ba smos so //

analyzed: skye gnas gsum /

analyzed: sgo nga las skye sogs pa dang // zhes bya ba smos te /
